**Title: The Last Echo**  

The sun was setting over the cemeteries of Mystery Inc., and Scooby Doo sat on a bench at the edge of the old lair. They had locked the trap, but the numbers didn’t make sense. The truth was buried deep, and Scooby, instead of rushing in, had gathered what he knew.  

“Scooby Doo,” he heard a voice say, but no one answered. Only the wind continued to stir the cemetery.  

He slumped back, rubbing his eyes. He didn’t want to think about it. The case had ended with nothing left but his memory. But this was the last day he had a chance to remember. The family had passed away, and the only thing left was the silence of the graveyard.  

For now, he allowed himself a brief moment of peace. He didn’t need to fight anymore.  

The wind snorted as he rose to leave, but as he reached the exit, a voice echoed in his mind. “We’ll be back, Scooby.”  

He laughed, but it was hollow. The world was gone. Only the grave and the silence remained.
